solution_line_template: She buys {num_curtain_pairs} pair of curtains for ${cost_per_curtain_pair} each so that's {num_curtain_pairs}*{cost_per_curtain_pair} = $<<{num_curtain_pairs}*{cost_per_curtain_pair}={curtains_total_cost}>>{curtains_total_cost}

She buys {num_wall_prints} wall prints at ${cost_per_wall_print} each so that's {num_wall_prints}*{cost_per_wall_print} = $<<{num_wall_prints}*{cost_per_wall_print}={prints_total_cost}>>{prints_total_cost}

The curtains cost ${curtains_total_cost}, the prints are ${prints_total_cost} and the installation service is ${installation_service_cost} for a total of {curtains_total_cost}+{prints_total_cost}+{installation_service_cost} = $<<{curtains_total_cost}+{prints_total_cost}+{installation_service_cost}={total_order_cost}>>{total_order_cost}
